metadata.author: Panaderia Libre
metadata.description: A soft and slightly tangy sourdough bread formula enhanced with buttermilk powder and a touch of sweetness.

ingredients.name: High-Protein Bread Flour
ingredients.notes: Forms the base of the dough.

ingredients.name: Natural Sourdough Starter
ingredients.notes: Provides leavening and characteristic sourdough flavor.

ingredients.name: Sea Salt
ingredients.notes: Enhances flavor and strengthens gluten structure.

ingredients.name: Olive Oil
ingredients.notes: Adds richness and a subtle nutty flavor.

making: Combine the flour, water, sourdough starter, sugar, and buttermilk powder in a large mixing bowl. Let it rest for 30 minutes (autolyse).
Add salt and olive oil to the mixture and knead until smooth.
Perform 3-4 sets of stretch-and-folds every 30 minutes during the bulk fermentation (about 4 hours at room temperature).
Shape the dough as needed (e.g., loaf, boule) and place it in a floured proofing basket or on a tray.
Cover and cold-proof in the refrigerator overnight (8-12 hours).
Preheat the oven to 250째C (480째F) with a Dutch oven or baking stone inside.
Transfer the dough to the preheated surface, score the top, and bake for 20 minutes with steam.
Reduce the oven temperature to 230째C (450째F) and bake for another 20-25 minutes until golden brown.

notes: This formula produces a soft sourdough loaf with a subtle tang from the buttermilk.
